summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing a request from the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for assistance in its regulatory investigation into Barclays CEO James Staley regarding his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The FCA is investigating Staley's fitness for duty and the accuracy of his statements about his relationship with Epstein, which he claimed ended in 2015. The FCA has been in contact with a source via the SDNY and seeks corroborating information from the FBI.

persons.name: James Staley
persons.role: CEO of Barclays Bank, subject of FCA investigation
persons.context: Subject of a UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) regulatory investigation concerning his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and his fitness to serve as CEO of Barclays Bank. He claims his relationship with Epstein ended in 2015.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure whose alleged misconduct and relationship with James Staley are under investigation by the FCA. The investigation seeks to determine if Staley was aware of Epstein's misconduct.

persons.name: Joe
persons.role: Assistant Legal Attaché, FBI/Legal Attaché London
persons.context: FBI official in London who received the FCA's request for assistance and is seeking internal guidance on how to respond, noting that the SDNY AUSA had already declined to provide information.

persons.name: Natalie Rivett
persons.context: FCA case manager for the investigation into James Staley (Op Downey). She was previously involved in the Beaufort case and is the point of contact for setting up a conference call with the FBI.

persons.name: Vijay Emmerson
persons.role: Team Leader, Intelligence Enforcement & Market Oversight Division, FCA
persons.context: FCA official who sent the initial request email to the FBI, outlining the investigation into James Staley and the request for information.

persons.name: Edward
persons.role: Department of Justice, Southern District of New York (SDNY)
persons.context: DOJ official in the SDNY who was contacted by the FCA. He declined to add to their investigation but connected the FCA to a source providing additional links between Staley and Epstein.

connections.description: The FCA is investigating the nature and extent of their personal relationship, which Staley claims ended in 2015. The investigation seeks to determine if it was a 'close personal relationship' and if Staley was aware of Epstein's misconduct.
Edward of the SDNY DOJ was contacted by the FCA regarding their investigation into Staley. He put the FCA in touch with a source who provided additional information on Staley-Epstein links.
FBI Legal Attaché Joe is coordinating with FCA Case Manager Natalie Rivett regarding the FCA's request for assistance in the Staley investigation, with plans for a conference call.
FCA Team Leader Vijay Emmerson sent the initial investigative request to FBI official Joe, seeking information and proposing further discussion.

events.title: FCA Opens Investigation into James Staley
events.description: The UK Financial Conduct Authority opens a regulatory investigation into James Staley, CEO of Barclays, concerning his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and his fitness for duty.

events.title: FCA Questions Barclays on Staley-Epstein Relationship
events.description: The FCA asks Barclays' senior management to review and satisfy itself regarding any relationship between the bank/Staley and Jeffrey Epstein, following public information about their connection.

events.title: Barclays Responds to FCA on Staley's Behalf
events.description: Barclays reports to the FCA that James Staley confirmed he did not have a close relationship with Epstein and was unaware of Epstein's alleged misconduct.

events.title: FCA Requests FBI Assistance in Staley Probe
events.description: The FCA, via email, formally requests assistance from the FBI's London Legal Attaché office to obtain information relevant to its investigation into James Staley's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 12 Endeavour Square, Stratford, London, E20 1JN, United Kingdom (FCA office)
keyFacts: The UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is conducting a regulatory investigation into Barclays CEO James Staley's fitness for duty, focusing on his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and whether he was aware of Epstein's misconduct.
James Staley claimed his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein ended in 2015 and that he did not have a close relationship with him, nor was he aware of Epstein's alleged criminal conduct.
The FCA was put in contact with a source by the SDNY DOJ (Edward) who provided 'further links' between Staley and Epstein, but the FCA has been unable to independently corroborate this information.

The FBI's London Legal Attaché office (Joe) is being asked to provide any relevant information, such as details of meetings, calls, or witness testimony, but has preliminarily indicated they likely have nothing to provide.
The investigation is considering whether Staley failed to act with integrity, failed to be open with the FCA, and failed to disclose relevant information about his Epstein ties.
